action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a bed and a wardrobe. The pillow is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The wardrobe is now open. The wardrobe is empty.

> close wardrobe

> go to passage

> enter hallway

> look around

> go back to bedroom

> take pillow from bed

> go to table

> put pillow on table

> go to wardrobe

> open wardrobe

> take book from wardrobe

> go to table

> put book on table

> go to hallway

> look around

> see plate on floor

> take plate from floor

> go to table

> put plate on table

> done

> open wardrobe

> see that wardrobe is empty

> close wardrobe

> go to passage

> enter hallway

> look around

> see plate on floor

> take plate from floor

> go back to bedroom

> go to table

> put plate on table

> done<|endoftext|>
The wardrobe is now open. The wardrobe is empty.

> close wardrobe

> done<|endoftext|>
